table.name: AaaPostalAddress
table.description: Address for User / Organization

table.name: AaaContactInfo
table.description: Contact information of User / Organization

table.name: AaaGenderHonorific
table.description: Represents possible gender to honorific combinations

table.name: AaaOrganization
table.description: Organization entity

table.name: AaaOrgDetail
table.description: Details about the Organization

table.name: AaaOrgStatus
table.description: Status of the Organization

table.name: AaaOrgPostalAddr
table.description: Postal address of the Organization

table.name: AaaOrgContactInfo
table.description: Contact information of Organization

table.name: AaaUser
table.description: User

table.name: AaaUserTwoFactorDetails
table.description: User two factor auth details

column.name: ENABLED
column.description: two factor authentication enabled or not.

column.name: TWOFACTORAUTHIMPL
column.description: two factor authentication implementation class name.

table.name: AaaUserProfile
table.description: User Profile

column.name: TIMEZONE
column.description: Identifier of Timezone to which the user belongs to

table.name: AaaUserStatus
table.description: User Status details

table.name: AaaUserProperty
table.description: User Property

table.name: AaaOrgUser
table.description: This entity maps the user to Organization to which they belong

table.name: AaaOrgContactUser
table.description: This entity maps the user i.e, contact person for the organization

table.name: AaaUserPostalAddr
table.description: Postal address of the User

table.name: AaaUserContactInfo
table.description: Contact information of User

table.name: AaaUserConfigRecord
table.description: Record used to capture User configuration information

table.name: AaaService
table.description: A service is an entity, that is secured by authentication. All the configurations are based on this service.

table.name: AaaModuleService
table.description: To map the application to service. This couples the Aaa data to Application name and hence facilitates cleanup of data.

table.name: AaaPamModule
table.description: Contains all available Pluggable Authentication Module (PAM) in the system

column.name: NAME
column.description: Name to identify the PAM module

column.name: TYPE
column.description: This indicates the type of the PAM functional module. It can be one of auth (authentication), account (account validation), password (password validation) or session (session management).

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.description: Description message for the PAM module

table.name: AaaPamModuleOption
table.description: Contains the list of arguments that are to be passed to the PAM module

table.name: AaaPamConf
table.description: This maps the list of AaaPamModules to the AaaService. i.e, it specifies the PAM modules to be used while authenticating users to access the service

column.name: CONTROL_FLAG
column.description: This determines the behavior of stacking multiple modules by specifying whether any particular module is required, sufficient, or optional.

column.name: EXECORDER
column.description: Just to maintain the order in which the pam modules get invoked

table.name: AaaPasswordRule
table.description: The defines the rule to be used to govern the password or to strengthen the password

column.name: MIN_LENGTH
column.description: Governs the minimum length of the password

column.name: MAX_LENGTH
column.description: Governs the maximum length of the password

column.name: REQ_MIXEDCASE
column.description: Governs whether the password should contain mixed case

column.name: NUMOF_SPLCHAR
column.description: Governs the number of special characters to be used. If the value is -1 then, it is not considered for validation

column.name: BEGINWITH_LETTER
column.description: Governs whether the password should begin with a alphabet

column.name: LOGINNAME_INDEPNDT
column.description: Governs if password can be same as loginname

table.name: AaaServicePasswordRule
table.description: This specifies the PasswordRule that validates the password created to access the service.

table.name: AaaAccAdminProfile
table.description: The profile used to manage account by restricting login, simultaneous login etc

column.name: EXP_AFTER
column.description: Relative value mentioning the expiry of the account. Based on this relative value and account create time, the AccountStatus table will be updated with the absolute value of expiry

column.name: DELETEON_EXPIRY
column.description: it is the number of additional login attempts required to automatically delete expired user accounts. The value of '0' means immediate deletion upon expiry.

column.name: NVRLOGIN_EXPLT
column.description: it is the number of minutes after which the maiden account will be expired

column.name: EXPEW_THRES
column.description: it is the number of days before account expiry to send an early warning message to the user.

column.name: FORCEOUT_ONEXP
column.description: it says whether the user sessions should be disconnected/cleaned when the currently logged in account is expired.

column.name: SIMUL_LOGIN
column.description: Number of simultaneous login allowed. The value '0' means no simultaneous login

column.name: ALLOWED_BADLOGIN
column.description: It is the number of simultaneous bad login attempts that can be allowed before the status is set as LoginFailed.

column.name: LOCK_PERIOD
column.description: It is the time duration for which the user account cannot be accessed after being set as LoginFailed.

column.name: LOGIN_CRITERIA
column.description: it is used to restrict user login based on a criteria / condition

table.name: AaaPasswordProfile
table.description: The profile used to manage password by controlling password expiry etc

column.name: EXP_AFTER
column.description: It is a relative value mentioning the number of days after which the password should expire from the creatime of current password

column.name: EXPEW_THRES
column.description: The number of days before password expiry to send an early warning message to the user

column.name: LOGIN_AFTEREXP
column.description: it is the additional number of times the password expired user is allowed to login.

column.name: UPDATE_INTERVAL
column.description: it is the number of days required to change the newly configured password.

column.name: CHPASSWD_ONFL
column.description: Indicates whether the user should change password on first login

column.name: NUMOF_OLDPASSWD
column.description: The number of old password to be remembered. '0' means that no old (recycled) passwords

column.name: PASSWORD_MIN_AGE
column.description: It is the number of days till which reuse of same password is restricted

table.name: AaaLogin
table.description: Login name used to access accounts

column.name: USER_ID
column.description: Identifier of AaaUser who owns the loginname

column.name: NAME
column.description: Login name to be used to access accounts owned by user

column.name: DOMAINNAME
column.description: Domain name to be used to access accounts owned by user based on the domain.

table.name: AaaAccount
table.description: Is is the main entity where the loginname is mapped to service and allowed to login.

column.name: SERVICE_ID
column.description: Identifier of AaaService to which the account has access to

column.name: ACCOUNTPROFILE_ID
column.description: Identifier of AccountProfile that manages the validity of the account

column.name: CREATEDTIME
column.description: Time at which the account was created

table.name: AaaAccountOwner
table.description: This entity captures the account owner details, i.e, who created the account

column.name: ACCOUNT_ID
column.description: Identifier of account that is created

column.name: OWNERACCOUNT_ID
column.description: Identifier of account who created the account referred in Account_id

table.name: AaaAccountStatus
table.description: This maintains the status of the account

column.name: ACCOUNT_ID
column.description: Identifier of account to which this info belongs to

column.name: EXPIREAT
column.description: Absolute value specifying the time at which the account expires

column.name: AFTEREXP_LOGIN
column.description: It specifies the number of times the user has tried to login to this account after expiry

column.name: STATUS
column.description: It specifies the current status of the account

column.name: UPDATEDTIME
column.description: Time at which the status was updated

table.name: AaaAccBadLoginStatus
table.description: This maintains the status of user account bad login attempts

column.name: ACCOUNT_ID
column.description: Identifier of account to which this info belongs to

column.name: NUMOF_BADLOGIN
column.description: This indicates the number of times he has logged in with bad password

column.name: HOST
column.description: It specifies the IPAddress of the host from where the attempts was made

column.name: UPDATEDTIME
column.description: Time at which the status was updated

column.name: HOST_NAME
column.description: It specifies the name of the host from where the attempts was made

table.name: AaaAccOwnerProfile
table.description: This entity captures parameters like number of accounts an existing account can create, etc

column.name: ALLOWED_SUBACCOUNT
column.description: It is the number of subaccounts that owner of this profile can create. value of -1 specifies he can create any number of subaccounts

table.name: AaaAccUserProfile
table.description: This entity captures parameters that can be modified by account user

column.name: SESSION_TIMEOUT
column.description: It indicates the number of minutes after which the session should be timedout. Value of -1 specifies no time out set and will be the same as in server server.xml

table.name: AaaAccSession
table.description: This entiry captures the session created when any user login to the system.

column.name: ACCOUNT_ID
column.description: Identifier of account to which the account belongs

column.name: USER_HOST
column.description: IP Address of the host from where the user is accessing the application

column.name: APPLICATION_HOST
column.description: host name where the application is running

column.name: OPENTIME
column.description: Time of session open, i.e, account login time

column.name: CLOSETIME
column.description: Time of session close, i.e, account logout or timeout time

column.name: USER_HOST_NAME
column.description: Host name from where the user connects the application.

column.name: APPLICATION_SERVER
column.description: host name where the application is running

table.name: AaaAccSessionProp
table.description: Record's used to capture properties for user account session

column.name: SESSION_ID
column.description: Identifier of AaaAccSession to which this property belongs to

table.name: AaaAccHttpSession
table.description: This entity maps the SingleSignId to AaaAccSession SESSION_ID

column.name: SSO_ID
column.description: SingleSignon Id generated and set in th cookie

table.name: AaaAccSessionAudit
table.description: This is used to capture all operations performed by a user via a particular login session.

table.name: AaaPassword
table.description: This entity captures the password details that is used to login to user account

column.name: PASSWORD
column.description: Password that is used to login to account

column.name: ALGORITHM
column.description: Algorithm that is supported to encrypt the password

column.name: SALT
column.description: Salt is a string that is used to encrypt the password.

column.name: PASSWDPROFILE_ID
column.description: Identifier of AaaPasswordProfile that manages the password

column.name: PASSWDRULE_ID
column.description: Identifier of password rule that is used to strengthen the password

table.name: AaaPasswordStatus
table.description: This maintains the status of the password

column.name: PASSWORD_ID
column.description: Identifier of password to which this info belongs to

column.name: EXPIREAT
column.description: Absolute value specifying the time at which the password expires

column.name: AFTEREXP_LOGIN
column.description: It specifies the number of times the user has tried to login using this password after expiry

column.name: STATUS
column.description: It specifies the current status of the password

column.name: UPDATEDTIME
column.description: Time at which the status was updated

column.name: CHANGE_PWD_ON_LOGIN
column.description: Indicates whether the user should change password on subsequent login

table.name: AaaPasswordHint
table.description: This entity contains the hint to identify passwords

column.name: PASSWORD_ID
column.description: Identifier of password to whcih the password hint belongs to

column.name: QUESTION
column.description: Question which is to be asked to user before resetting password

column.name: ANSWER
column.description: The answer which is to be verified with user input for the question above

table.name: AaaAccPassword
table.description: This maps the account to the password that is to be used to login to account

table.name: AaaAccOldPassword
table.description: This maps the account to the old password that were used

table.name: AaaRole
table.description: It defines the role defined for an application in order to access resources, or perform business function provided by the application.

column.name: SERVICE_ID
column.description: Identifier of Service to which the role belongs to

table.name: AaaRoleCategory
table.description: It defines category this role has privilege to, for example it can be tab roles, administration roles, etc. Category can be predefined by the applications and used to map the roles to the category.

table.name: AaaRoleToCategory
table.description: It maps the role to category

table.name: AaaRoleOwner
table.description: Entity that captures the ownership of roles. A SalesAdministrator (role) may create roles like SalesUserGrpA, SalesUserGrpB. When role SalesAdministrator is deleted, the roles SalesUserGrpA and SalesUserGroupB will also be deleted

column.name: OWNERROLE_ID
column.description: Identifier of Role that owns it

table.name: AaaImpliedRole
table.description: Entity that captures the hierachy of roles. This help administrator to define policy easily. i.e if the administrator chooses top role for a user then all the implied role will be systematically assigned to that user

column.name: IMPLIEDROLE_ID
column.description: Identifier of Role that is being implied

table.name: AaaAuthorizedRole
table.description: This entity defines the privilege of an account by mapping account to roles

column.name: ACCOUNT_ID
column.description: Identifier of AaaAccount to which the roles are mapped

column.name: ROLE_ID
column.description: Identifier of role which is mapped to account

table.name: ActiveDirectoryInfo
table.description: Information of the Active directory

column.name: SERVERNAME
column.description: The machine name in which AD is running

column.name: DEFAULTDOMAIN
column.description: The default domain to be used when none is specified by the user

column.name: USERNAME
column.description: The user name to be used for logging into the active directory

column.name: PASSWORD
column.description: The password for logging into the active directory

column.name: SECONDARYSERVERNAME
column.description: The secondary domain controllers in csv format

table.name: AAARadiusConfig
table.description: RADIUS Configurations

table.name: SAMLSP
table.description: SAML configurations of Service Provider

column.name: ACS_URL
column.description: Assertion Consumer Service URL - servelt mappin is needed

column.name: AUTH_REQUEST_SIGNED
column.description: Whether AuthnRequest sent from SP to IDP needs to be signed

table.name: SAMLIDP
table.description: SAML configurations of Identity Provider

column.name: SSO_URL
column.description: URL Target of the IdP where the SP will send the Authentication Request Message

column.name: SLO_URL
column.description: URL Location of the IdP where the SP will send the SLO Request

column.name: SLO_RESPONSE_URL
column.description: URL Location of the IdP where the SP will send the SLO response, if this is null, SLO_URL will considered to send response

column.name: SIGNED
column.description: whether logout request and response should be signed. If signed is true, SP's certificate should be uploaded in IDP portal

column.name: VALIDATE_SIGNATURE
column.description: whether the signature of logout request or response from IDP should be validated. This is added as some IDPs are not signing the request but sending signature parameter.

column.name: ALGORITHM
column.description: Algorithm used to sign logout request or response

column.name: NAME_ID_FORMAT
column.description: Name Id format of login name

column.name: BINDING
column.description: binding to be used for saml auth request, logout request and logout response. This will be useful only when signing is enabled

table.name: AUTHCONFIG
table.description: Stores information about which authentication mode is enabled

column.name: AUTH_MODE
column.description: authentication mode. GENERAL can be LOCAL/AD/RADIUS which user chooses during login. OTHERS are SSO modes

table.name: AAARememberMeInfo
table.description: Stores information about which authentication mode is enabled
